p: Comparing the two climate change scenarios separately, divergent responses were observed for different plant traits. In relation to the current scenario, areas with a high occurrence probability for tree species ( Fig 4D–4F), species with specialized pollination systems ( Fig 5D–5F), and those with self-compatible reproductive systems ( Fig 6A–6C) tend to be similarly reduced under both the best-case and worst-case scenarios. In the case of non-arboreous species ( Fig 4A–4C), species with generalist pollination systems ( Fig 5A–5C), and obligatory cross-pollinated species ( Fig 6D–6F), reduced areas of high occurrence probability will be even more severe under the pessimistic scenario ( Table 3; Fig 3). Conversely, suitable habitats for species with abiotic dispersal modes will be most reduced under the optimistic climate change scenario ( Table 3; Fig 7).
